entry.title: ROSEBURG HAD THE 10TH DRIEST JANUARY ON RECORD
entry.summary: February 1, 2026 9:30 a.m. Roseburg had the 10th driest January on record since data began being recorded in 1899. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford said the Roseburg Regional Airport received 1.92 inches of rain during the month. That is approximately only 40 percent of the normal rainfall for the month, which...

entry.title: VEHICLE CRASHES ON OLD HIGHWAY 99 SOUTH IN GREEN
entry.summary: February 1, 2026 8:50 a.m. No one was hurt when a vehicle crashed in the 4000 block of Old Highway 99 south in the Green District early Friday morning. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said at approximately 5:45 a.m. the driver fell asleep at the wheel after working a graveyard shift. His SUV hit...

entry.title: AZALEA MAN JAILED FOR ALLEGED DISORDERLY CONDUCT AND MENACING INCIDENT
entry.summary: February 1, 2026 8:30 a.m. An Azalea man was jailed for an alleged disorderly conduct and menacing incident on Friday. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said at 3:45 p.m. a caller said a man was driving around a trailer park in a pickup in the 800 block of Autum Lane in Azalea, peeling out...

entry.title: Peace at Home Announces 15th Annual EMPOWER Dance & Vocal Fundraiser in Douglas County
entry.summary: Peace at Home will host the 15th annual EMPOWER Dance & Vocal Fundraiser on Feb. 28 at Seven Feathers Casino Resort, featuring local performances supporting survivors of domestic and sexual violence. A $25,000 match will apply to paddle raise donations. Tickets and details online.

entry.title: Brew Change for CASA to Raise Funds for Local Children in Douglas County
entry.summary: Brew Change for CASA is set for Feb. 3, 5–8 p.m. at Two Shy Brewing. Half of proceeds from select brews will benefit CASA of Douglas County, supporting local children in foster care. Raffle and volunteers on site.

entry.title: OSP And Local Agencies Respond To Reports Of Shots Fired From Vehicle Along I-5 In Douglas County
entry.summary: OSP and local agencies responded to reports of a man firing a gun from a vehicle on I-5 near milepost 128 Thursday morning. The suspect, a 53-year-old Winston man, was taken into custody after a non-injury crash. Investigators are reviewing the incident for possible bias crime elements, police said.

entry.title: OSP ARRESTS WINSTON MAN ON 23 CHARGES, SHOTS FIRED FROM A VEHICLE
entry.summary: January 30, 2026 4:00 p.m. Oregon State Police have arrested a Winston man on 23 charges, following a series of incidents, some allegedly involving a firearm, on Interstate 5 just north of Roseburg on Thursday morning. An OSP report released on Friday afternoon said just before 8:20 a.m. OSP and local law enforcement agencies responded...

entry.title: Douglas County chaos: gunfire on I-5 leads to arrest
entry.summary: Authorities swiftly responded to reports of a firearm discharge on Interstate 5 in Douglas County on Thursday, according to the Oregon State Police.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 01.30.26
entry.summary: Live from Ford’s Pond west of Sutherlin, Friends of Ford’s Pond board members Jim and Beth Houseman and Andrew Chione give an update on what’s been happening at the pond and what is planned for this spring. They also provided information on how others can get involved as well.

An RPD report said at approximately 2:15 a.m. officers contacted a 47-year-old man who was camping underneath multiple blankets near a business in the 1900 block of Northeast Diamond Lake Boulevard. entry.title: TWO DRIVERS EXTRICATED AND TRANSPORTED TO HOSPITAL

An RPD report said just after 8:00 a.m. officers responded to the wreck at the intersection of Northwest Edenbower Boulevard and Northwest Renann Avenue. After an investigation, it was determined that the 23-year-old pickup driver had accelerated quickly...

entry.title: Planting for the future: Reforestation in Western Oregon
entry.summary: The holiday season is over. We’ve all taken down our decorations and disposed of those dried out Christmas trees that graced our homes throughout December. However, just because it’s the end of the holiday season, doesn’t mean we are done…

entry.title: Public events at the observatory to return in spring
entry.summary: February brings seven planets to the evening sky. As February opens, look to the southwestern sky to spot modest Saturn. Binocular observers can also spy Neptune about 1 degree from Saturn. Swing to the east and spy bright Jupiter. As…

entry.title: Police Log: January 29, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg Police Log: Arson arrest tied to a Jan. 19 apartment incident, multiple warrant/prohibited camping arrests along the bike path, and citations from a rollover crash after an attempted “burnout,” plus littering and mischief cases.

entry.title: Safety and technology advances at Douglas County parks
entry.summary: In an effort to improve safety and modernize local parks, Douglas County announced several new upgrades to parks across the county.

entry.title: Local Team Honored: Roseburg Towing Named Best Towing Company in Douglas County
entry.summary: Voted #1 Best Towing Company in Douglas County in the 2025 Readers’ Choice Awards, Roseburg Towing LLC has served the community since 1969 with 24/7 towing and roadside help. Family owned and locally trusted, the team is known for fast, professional, dependable service when drivers need it most.

entry.title: Explore what Umpqua Community College has to offer
entry.summary: WINCHESTER — John Blakely said he owned an auto repair shop in Sutherlin for about 19 years, starting right out in the profession after attending Umpqua Community College. After he ended his career, he returned to the college and has…

entry.title: Eastwood Elementary students fish with the Umpqua Fishery Enhancement Derby
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — Eastwood Elementary School fifth graders spent Thursday morning outside in the on-and-off rain, fishing and floating around Cooper Creek Reservoir.

entry.title: Robotics Program at Jo Lane Middle School Inspires Creativity, Teamwork, and Growth
entry.summary: Students at Jo Lane Middle School are turning ideas into reality through robotics, gaining hands on experience in engineering, teamwork, and problem solving. From regional competitions to mentoring younger students, the program is helping build confidence, skills, and future opportunities.

entry.title: I-5 Temporarily Closed Near Roseburg After Reported Shooting; Suspect in Custody
entry.summary: Oregon State Police says a suspect discharged a firearm along Interstate 5 north of Exit 127 in Roseburg, prompting a temporary closure. The suspect is in custody, no injuries were reported, and Oregon Department of Transportation confirmed the freeway has reopened.

entry.title: Roseburg traffic stop uncovers $24k cash and cocaine stash
entry.summary: A traffic stop near Roseburg on Sunday afternoon resulted in a significant drug bust, with Oregon State Police seizing cocaine and cash.

entry.title: 15th Annual Empower Dance & Vocals Performance set for Feb. 28
entry.summary: CANYONVILLE — Peace at Home Advocacy Center has its 15th Annual Empower Dance & Vocals Performance 2026 happening at 5:30 p.m. Saturday, Feb. 28 at Seven Feathers Casino Resort in Canyonville.

entry.title: Roseburg police jail man for alleged prior sexual assault
entry.summary: Roseburg police jailed a man Friday for an alleged prior sexual assault incident.

entry.title: OSP K-9 team seizes illegal drugs following county traffic stop
entry.summary: SCOTTS VALLEY — A recent Oregon State Police (OSP) traffic stop in Douglas County led to the seizure of a large quantity of cocaine and cash.

entry.title: Sutherlin School District announces finalists for superintendent interviews
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — The Sutherlin School District Board of Directors has announced that two candidates have been selected for interviews for the superintendent position.

entry.title: Police Log: January 28, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg police arrested multiple people Jan. 28–29 in cases tied to forged checks, warrants, prohibited camping/littering near waterways, trespass, and theft. Several were lodged at Douglas County Corrections, while others were cited and released.

entry.title: County Commissioners Mark Retirement of Bill Clemens, Appoint Phil McAfee as New Building Official
entry.summary: Douglas County commissioners appointed Phil McAfee as Building Official effective February 1 after Bill Clemens retired following 11 years with the county. Leaders thanked Clemens for his service and expressed confidence in McAfee’s leadership moving forward.

entry.title: UCAN partners with local organizations for 2026 Point-in-Time Count
entry.summary: Each January, the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development kicks off the Point-in-Time Count to tally how many Americans are experiencing homelessness on a single day.

entry.title: Douglas County’s unemployment rate held steady in December
entry.summary: Douglas County’s seasonally adjusted unemployment rate was unchanged at 6.4% in December, compared to the revised November rate.

entry.title: January 29, 2026

entry.title: High school students learn about outdoor careers with the Umpqua Fisherman Enhancement Derby
entry.summary: IDLEYLD PARK — Hunter Stephens is taking the forestry class at Roseburg High School, and on Wednesday he was a member of the group that went on a field trip to Rock Creek Recreation Site in Idleyld Park.

entry.title: Oregon, Douglas County graduation rates keep improving
entry.summary: Data released Thursday morning by the Oregon Department of Education (ODE) showed graduation rates keep trending upwards for Oregon and Douglas County.
